You WILL encounter location issues using IP-based apps like Netflix and other functions that attempt to authenticate your IP address. You will die trying to let a site know you are not a Robot until you shut IPvanish down, leaving you vulnerable to what it was designed for. While moving my computing to another solution I discovered I cannot end my subscription on the website. Clicking the Cancel Subscription WILL NOT CANCEL IT. Calling support, they dodged the issue. It's not in their financial bottom line interest. So I removed the payment information which was the only solution. Sure enough I got a notification to update my payment info. So, be careful what you start - you will have to divorce them to end the subscription.

Review.Titre: BBC iPlayer will not work with IPVanish when abroad - official confirmation from IPVanish
Review.Contenu: Despite a number of days of emails back and forth between me and IPVanish about the inability to connect to BBCiPlayer from abroad, with ‘try this city, try this sever, try this fix’, IPV have finally provided this statement:“Despite our best technical efforts, IPVanish can no longer support access to BBC. Our hope is to make IPVanish work with as many websites as possible, but it is more important for us to remain transparent with you about this restriction. The BBC has taken measures to block all VPN connections from IPVanish. Though we have implored the network not to target those protecting their online privacy with our service, these pleas have fallen upon deaf ears. While our team works hard accommodating service access for streaming video, we wish to gently remind you that IPVanish is primarily a privacy product and should be used as such. We apologize for any inconvenience. ”Whether this is the final ‘fob-off’ line simply to close down my ticket, or the reality of the situation, I don’t know, but others might like to draw their own conclusions.

I've used Ipvanish on several devices for many years.I recently purchased a new Amazon firestick 4K max & wanted to connect via my existing Ipvanish account.I was unable to sign in using my existing credentials. After many frustrating attempts, I tried to contact phone support. After 3 attempts, including leaving a call back number, eventually I called again & was able to connect to support personnel. I was surprised to learn that I could no longer sign in with my existing password, as it contains the special character '#'. I was also informed that the character '!' cannot be used.Customers should be made aware of this condition. It would have saved me hours of frustration.Additionally, once signed in, I was unable to connect to my optimum server. I used live chat & was advised to change the protocol from 'wireguard' to 'open VPN'.Following this advice, my device is now successfully connected.Strangely enough, all my other devices are using a password with the # character & are connected via the wireguard protocol.I'm happy with IP Vanish, but the company really needs to share this information with customers, to avoid wasting time & effort.

Nothing too major, easy to overcome and expect will go away with some additional updates/tweaking (most notable is when pinging the full list of servers - sometimes app is not responsive and sometimes you want to force the refresh of ping times but it won't let you. Mobile client could work more like Astrill which provides a more seamless iOS experience. Anyway you slice it, IPVanish gets the job done.

I'm sure that isn't set up any delay for this program. I don't know why so that is always start last.Very nice graphic interface and some tools are useful, like the LAN Task Kill and prevention of IPV6 leaks or DNS leaks. The "Scramble" function, instead, does not prevent at all from being recognized as VPN users.Overall, it can be improved a lot, but the bases are good. Review.Titre: I recently signed up for IPVanish VPN…
Review.Contenu: I recently signed up for IPVanish VPN and have been blown away by the service. The sign-up process was simple and the installation was a breeze. Once I was up and running, the speed and reliability of the VPN were exceptional. I was able to browse the web, stream videos, and download files without any lag or buffering issues.What really stood out to me was the company's commitment to privacy and security. IPVanish utilizes top-of-the-line encryption and has a strict no-logging policy, so I feel confident that my online activity is secure and private.In addition, the customer support team was extremely helpful when I had a question about setting up the VPN on my device. They were quick to respond and provided clear instructions that made the process easy.Overall, I highly recommend IPVanish to anyone looking for a reliable and secure VPN. The company's commitment to privacy and customer service sets them apart from the competition. 5 stars!

I have had IP Vanish for three years now and have not had any problems that couldn't be solved with an email or phone call.  I still operate a laptop using Windows 7.  They provided me a VPN version to accommodate my Operating System (OS) even though they are using upgraded versions for current Operating Systems.  They always modify my annual cost to a lower amount.  But I do have to contact Customer Service around renewal time to negotiate a change in price.  If anything, I would like to suggest to your business, for the subscribers that have a long standing order with your services, when a person is coming up for annual renewal, IP Vanish should reward and advertise exclusively to those customers, beforehand, a reduced renewal rate to inspire repeat/recurring service.  Instead of having the customer contact and haggle a reduced rate.  There are so many VPN services always advertising great deals to steal business away from you.  Customers like to have attention.  It makes us feel wanted, even though we already know this.  Validation if you will.  When a customer is handed a reduced renewal service plan prior expiration, it makes the process and decision easy.  Easy is good.  Reward loyalty and excite your customers. Thank you. Dale
